refnamediv.refpurpose: A virtual filesystem that allows access of groups of files as if they were a single large one

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: concat-fuse is a FUSE based filesystem that allows accessing groups of files as if they were a single large file. In most cases direct interaction with concat-fuse isn't needed, as the convinience tool cfconcat hides the plumbing away.

refsect1.title: Options
refsect1.para: concat-fuse doesn't provide options on it's own, but will accept the general mount options provided by fuse8

refsect1.title: Structure
refsect1.para: The filesystem, once mounted, provides two subdirectories named from-file0/ and from-glob0/. Writing a '\0' separated list of files or glob pattern to the control file within those directories will create a virtual file containing all the content of the individual files. The name of the virtual file is the sha1 checksum of the data written to the control file.
